titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T20:14-0400

did.unittitle: Journal during the survey of the Pennsylvania-Maryland line, 1763-1768
did.abstract: This journal was written during the survey of the Mason and Dixon line. Also on this reel are minutes from the Joint Commissioners of Lord Baltimore and the Penns (1760-1768), and field notes and journal of the surveys of Lord Baltimore and the Penns (1761-1763).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Presented by Thomas D. Cope and accessioned, 1946. See in-house shelf list for additional accession information and location of materials.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: This material is also available in photocopy form, see Correspondence and accounts of the Mason and Dixon survey (B M381.1).

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Charles Mason was an astronomer and surveyor; he was elected to the American Philosophical Society in 1768.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Originals in The National Archives, Washington, D.C.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This is a microfilm of an early American collection that may be of interest to researchers at the APS and may complement an original manuscript collection at the APS.
